Title: Object: Sanctissimae Familiae in Aegyptum fuga
Description: Rest during the flight into Egypt, with in the centre foreground of a landscape the Holy Family sitting under a tree while on the left a female figure is seen picking some fruit from a tree, and a boy wearing a fur (St John the Baptist?) offers them some fruits; after Titian; plate from Patin's 'Tabellae selectae ac explicatae (Padua 1691, p.38); title and illustration printed from two separate plates. c.1691 Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Noël Robert Cochin
Curator's comments: One of the twenty-two illustrations engraved by N.C. Cochin for 'Tabellae selectae ac explicatae', see 1859,0709.2452 for comment. According to the inscription the original was lost at sea while being transported to Spain. Another impression: 1877,0811.672.
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (5)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: A E Evans & Sons
